contentrichtext.text: '''[[Truro]]''' is the county town of Cornwall. It may also refer to: *[[Truro, Nova Scotia]], Canada *[[Truro, Iowa]], United States *[[Truro, Massachusetts]], United States *[[Truro, South Australia]], Australia *[[Truro Parish]], Virginia, United States *[[Truro Township, Franklin County, Ohio]], United States *[[Truro Township, Knox County, Illinois]], United States ==People== *[[Thomas Wilde, 1st Baron Truro]] (1783-1855), English jurist and Lord Chancellor ==Railway locomotives== *''Truro'', a [[West Cornwall Railway#Locomotives|West Cornwall Railway locomotive]] *[[GWR 3700 Class 3440 City of Truro|GWR 3700 Class 3440 ''City of Truro'']], a Great Western Railway 4-4-0 steam locomotive, is claimed to be the first locomotive to have exceeded 100 MPH ==Other uses== * [[Truro Murders]], a series of murders in South Australia named after the town near where the remains of the victims were dumped *[[Truro (ship)|''Truro'' (ship)]], a ship that carried the first batch of indentured Indian labourers to South Africa * Fictional [[Florida]] town in the 1980s TV series [[Flamingo Road (TV series)|Flamingo Road]]. {{disambig}} [[Category:Place name disambiguation pages]]
